edu.xtec.jclic.boxes

Class AbstractBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.geom.RectangularShape
      • java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D
        • java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double
          • edu.xtec.jclic.boxes.AbstractBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Shape, Serializable, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActiveBox, BoxBag, Counter, SimpleBox, TextGrid

    public abstract class AbstractBox
extends Rectangle2D.Double
implements Cloneable
    This abstract class is the base for most graphic components of JClic. It describes an Area (a rectangle by default) with some special properties that determine how it must be drawn on screen. Some types of boxes can act as containers for other boxes, establishing a hierarchy of dependences. Box objects are always placed into a JComponent.
    Version:
    13.08.28
    Author:
    Francesc Busquets (fbusquets@xtec.cat)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
